title: Update app color scheme to match logo tonality

requirements.text: Update the application's color palette in frontend/index.css to use the same tonality as the logo colors. Replace the current warm orange primary and deep navy blue secondary colors with colors that match the logo's visual identity while maintaining appropriate contrast ratios for accessibility.
acceptanceCriteria: The primary and secondary color variables in the CSS use tonalities matching the logo
All color references throughout the app reflect the new palette
Text remains readable with appropriate contrast against backgrounds
Dark mode color variants are updated to maintain consistency

requirements.text: Update the theme color in frontend/index.html and frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest to match the updated primary color from the new palette, ensuring consistency across browser UI elements and PWA theming.
acceptanceCriteria: The theme-color meta tag in index.html reflects the new primary color
The theme_color in manifest.webmanifest matches the updated palette
Browser UI chrome displays the correct brand color

constraints: Do not modify any files in frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
Maintain WCAG AA contrast ratio standards for text and interactive elements
Preserve the OKLCH color space system already in use
nonGoals: Creating or modifying the logo file itself
Changing the overall layout or component structure
